media: Nick Majerus, NSF, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

Note: Because the poles are not inlcuded in my dataset, it is not possible to say with certainty what climate it would be in future projections, especially in end of century high emissions projections. However, the 1981-2010 normals on wikipedia show that the South Pole is clearly within the YY climate for that time period.

Cc1 is a very rare, almost theoretical climate that typically occurs near the boundary with another climate category. It is found on Heard Island in the coastal, mossy areas, bordering the Dc1 climate.
